info.title: Uvch.cz API
info.description: Full description of current API version supported on uvch.cz and other related websites

Basic.description: **It is not supported yet**, but will be implemented before going to public. For now, you can provide any combination of username / password. Even though the system does not even check whether the header is present, it's good idea to implement it so the system will not break when the support for Basic HTTP Authorization is added.

tags.name: AccommodationUnit
tags.description: All calls which are dealing with the accommodation unit

tags.name: Location
tags.description: All calls which are dealing with the location (region, city etc)

tags.name: Others
tags.description: All the call which cannot be groupped

post.description:
Each client needs an auth_token to communicate with the rest of the API. 
This endpoint will provide such auth_token against valid combination of `username` and `password`

parameters.name: usename
parameters.description: Username of the user

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: Password of the user

get.summary: Retrieve the list of last minute offers
get.description:
Returns the information about last minute offers.

In order for last-minute offer to be shown, there're some conditions to be passed

1. Client has an active profile
2. Accommodation unit is active
3. Last-minute offer has start date within specified range

parameters.name: start
parameters.description:
**FORMAT: YYYY-mm-dd, eg. 2017-02-25**

The starting date from when the last minutes should be checked. 

If you specify eg. 2017-05-01, you want to see all last minute offers which will start from 01.05.2017 (their starting date >= 01.05.2017)

When we go live, I will block all requests, with `start` in the past, but right now it's still possible. 

**Also, if the value is not provided, the current date is used instead.**

parameters.name: end
parameters.description:
**FORMAT: YYYY-mm-dd, eg. 2017-02-25**

The last date when the last minute offer can start. 

If you specify eg. 2017-05-01, you want to see all last-minute offers which will start latest 01.05.2017 (their starting date <= 01.05.2017)

Also it must be later than `start`

parameters.name: client
parameters.description:
Possible to insert the ID of the client. 

System will find only the last-time offers from this specific client

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: Possible to search by keyword in cities / regions

parameters.name: region
parameters.description:
Possible to set up the region the last minute must be from

#### Available options:
* **dubrovnik**
* **istrie**
* **kvarner**
* **sibenik**
* **split**
* **zadar**

parameters.name: city
parameters.description:
Possible to set up the city the last minute must be from

**WARNING** - it's still possible to send a request for the `city` and `region`, but invalid combination will not lead to the response error, but only to empty response data

#### Available options:
* **babinopolje**

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Possible to set up how many maximum items should be returned back

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Possible to say which page of the result set you want to receive

parameters.name: person
parameters.description:
Possible to say how many people must be able to be accommodated in the accommodation unit 

The calculation takes into consideration sum from regular and extra bed - both "beds" have same value. 

So in case we have accommodation unit with 5 regular beds and 4 extra beds, the system consider this unit as suitable for up to 9 persons

parameters.name: sea
parameters.description: Possible to specify the maximum number of meters from the sea

parameters.name: center
parameters.description: Possible to specify the maximum number of meters from the center

parameters.name: max_price
parameters.description: Possible to specify the maximum price for last minute price. Must be greater than 0

parameters.name: min_price
parameters.description: Possible to specify the minimum price for last minute price. Must be greater than 0

parameters.name: features
parameters.description:
Possible to specify which extras / feature the client must have 

In case you want to specify more than 1 feature, join them with comma (`,`), eg. `pool,animals`, order does not matter.

#### Available options:
* **air_condition**
* **animals**
* **balcony**
* **bedding**
* **concrete_beach**
* **cooker**
* **freezer**
* **fridge**
* **garage**
* **grill**
* **half_board**
* **kettle**
* **microwave**
* **parking**
* **pc**
* **pebble_beach**
* **phone**
* **pool**
* **radio**
* **sand_beach**
* **taxa**
* **tennis**
* **terrace**
* **towels**
* **tv_sat**
* **washmachine**
* **yard**

parameters.name: order
parameters.description:
Influence the sorting direction of the response

##### Available options:

* **asc** : 1 -> 10
* **desc** : 10 -> 1

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Gives you an option to influence, how the data will be sorted before returned. 

##### Available options:

* **sea** - Distance from the sea
* **price** - Lastminute price
* **name** - Name of the client
* **person** - Number or persons

description.example: 3 bedrooms, big terrasse with sea view,2 toilets,free air-conditioning,free parking, free wi-fi.

get.summary: Retrieve profile information for specific LastMinute offer
get.description:
Returns the information about certain lastMinute offer

1. Client has an active profile
2. Accommodation unit is active

parameters.name: lastminute_id
parameters.description: ID of the last minute offer you want data for

description.example: 3 bedrooms, big terrasse with sea view,2 toilets,free air-conditioning,free parking, free wi-fi.

get.description:
Returns list of active clients. For each one of them system provides basic information which should be enough to show client's main profile card.
The result can be affected by using optional parameters.
System does not return all valid results, but supports pagination.

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: Possible to set up the destination the clients must be from

parameters.name: region
parameters.description:
Possible to set up the region the clients must be from

#### Available options:
* **dubrovnik**
* **istrie**
* **kvarner**
* **sibenik**
* **split**
* **zadar**

parameters.name: city
parameters.description:

parameters.description: Possible to set up how many maximum items should be returned back

parameters.description:
Possible to say how many people must be able to be accommodated in the accommodation unit 

The calculation takes into consideration sum from regular and extra bed - both "beds" have same value. 

So in case we have accommodation unit with 5 regular beds and 4 extra beds, the system consider this unit as suitable for up to 9 persons

Possible to specify which extras / feature the client must have

parameters.name: start
parameters.description:
**FORMAT: YYYY-mm-dd, eg. 2017-02-25**

This is used to check availability + eg. min price

**Also, if the value is not provided, the current date is used instead.**

parameters.name: end
parameters.description:
**FORMAT: YYYY-mm-dd, eg. 2017-02-25**

Used to check availability + eg. min price.

Also it must be later than `start`

parameters.name: order
parameters.description:
Influence the sorting direction of the response

##### Available options:

* **asc** : 1 -> 10
* **desc** : 10 -> 1

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Gives you an option to influence, how the data will be sorted before returned. 

##### Available options:

* **priority** - Clients will be sorted by their priority
* **created** - Clients will be sorted by the date / time when they created their account
* **name** - Client will be sorted by their names

get.description: Returns Latitude and Longitude of the client

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: Id of the client we want to tranfer GPS for

patch.description: Transfers GPS information (latitude, longitude) from old database to the new structure

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: Id of the client we want to tranfer GPS for

get.description: Returns more information about the client. The basic information set can get extended by using fields parameter.

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: Id of the client we want a profile for

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
List of optional information you would like to recieve

##### Available options:

* **languages** - list of languages the client speaks
* **address** - information about the client address
* **distances** - information about distances from important locations
* **description** - main description for the client - possible to loacalize by using `locale` option

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description:
Possible to localize the response, mostly use in combination with `?fields=description`

##### Available options:

* cz
* de
* en
* fr
* hr
* it
* pl

200.description:
Successful response. 

NOTE: The response may vary depending on additional parameters which you can set up, like `fields` or `locale`

get.description: Returns list of the photos the client has added for his main profile.

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: Id of the client we want photos for

get.summary: Retrieve list of client's accommodation units
get.description: Returns list of accommodation units which client has. API provides basic information about each of such accommodation unit.

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: Id of the client we want accommodation units for

get.description: Returns detailed information about certain unit

parameters.name: unit_id
parameters.description: Id of the accommodation unit we want detailed information for

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
List of the additional information to be loaded

Options: 
  * extra_fees
  * price_lists
  * accessories
  * description

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Locale for the translated values, eg. description

200.description:
Successful response

Some of the data listed below depends on the query

* price_lists <- ?fields=price_lists
* extra_fees <- ?fields=extra_fees
* accessories <- ?fields=accessories
* description <- ?fields=description

post.description: Possible to set new url for iCalc calendar.

parameters.name: unit_id
parameters.description: Id of the accommodation unit we want detailed information for

get.description:
Returns list of current supported regions with basic information 
about each one of them.
Returns more information about the region itself. Also provides useful links where to go from here.

parameters.name: region_id
parameters.description: ID of the region

get.summary: Retrieve the list of cities within the region
get.description: Returns list of cities within selected region. Each city contain basic information about itself and list of links to retrieve more inforamtation about each one.

parameters.name: region_id
parameters.description: ID of the region

get.description:
Returns more detailed information about the city. 
The requirements are that the city belongs to the region.

parameters.name: region_id
parameters.description: ID of the region

parameters.name: city_id
parameters.description: ID of the city

description.example: the unit is the best, blablabla ...

address.description: only when address is listed in fields params

languages.description: only when languages is listed in fields params
